solution_line_template: Since Patricia has {patricia_money} dollars, then Lisa has {patricia_money} * {lisa_multiplier} = <<{patricia_money}*{lisa_multiplier}={lisa_money}>>{lisa_money} dollars.
Patricia's money is double Charlotte's, meaning that Charlotte has {lisa_money}/{charlotte_divisor} = <<{lisa_money}/{charlotte_divisor}={charlotte_money}>>{charlotte_money} dollars.

Adding up all the money they have gives a total of {patricia_money} + {lisa_money} + {charlotte_money} = <<{patricia_money}+{lisa_money}+{charlotte_money}={total_money_collected}>>{total_money_collected} dollars.
Since the rare card costs {card_cost} dollars, the girls require an additional {card_cost} -{total_money_collected} = <<{card_cost}-{total_money_collected}={money_required}>>{money_required} dollars
